property.name: kdc_type
property.description: The type of KDC being used. Either mit-kdc, ipa, or active-directory

property.name: kadmin_principal_name
property.description: The principal name of kAdmin service principal

property.name: manage_identities
property.description: Indicates whether the Ambari user and service Kerberos identities (principals and keytab files) should be managed (created, deleted, updated, etc...) by Ambari or managed manually.

property.name: manage_auth_to_local
property.description: Indicates whether the hadoop auth_to_local rules should be managed by Ambari or managed manually.

property.name: install_packages
property.description: Indicates whether Ambari should install the Kerberos client package(s) or not. If not, it is expected that Kerberos utility programs (such as kadmin, kinit, klist, and kdestroy) are compatible with MIT Kerberos 5 version 1.10.3 in command line options and behaviors.

property.name: ldap_url
property.description: The URL to the Active Directory LDAP Interface Example: ldaps://ad.example.com:636

property.name: container_dn
property.description: The distinguished name (DN) of the container used store service principals

property.name: encryption_types
property.description: The supported list of session key encryption types that should be returned by the KDC.

property.name: realm
property.description: The default realm to use when creating service principals

property.name: kdc_hosts
property.description: A comma-delimited list of IP addresses or FQDNs declaring the KDC hosts. Optionally a port number may be included in each entry by separating each host and port by a colon (:). Example: kdc1.example.com:88, kdc2.example.com:88

property.name: master_kdc
property.description: The IP address or FQDN of the master KDC host in a master-slave KDC deployment. Optionally a port number may be included. Example: kdc1.example.com:88

property.name: admin_server_host
property.description: The FQDN for the KDC Kerberos administrative host. Optionally a port number may be included.

property.name: executable_search_paths
property.description: A comma-delimited list of search paths to use to find Kerberos utilities like kadmin, kinit and ipa.

property.name: password_length
property.description: The length required length for generated passwords.

property.name: password_min_lowercase_letters
property.description: The minimum number of lowercase letters (a-z) required in generated passwords

property.name: password_min_uppercase_letters
property.description: The minimum number of uppercase letters (A-Z) required in generated passwords

property.name: password_min_digits
property.description: The minimum number of digits (0-9) required in generated passwords

property.name: password_min_punctuation
property.description: The minimum number of punctuation characters (?.!$%^*()-_+=~) required in generated passwords

property.name: password_min_whitespace
property.description: The minimum number of whitespace characters required in generated passwords

property.name: service_check_principal_name
property.description: The principal name to use when executing the Kerberos service check

property.name: case_insensitive_username_rules
property.description: Force principal names to resolve to lowercase local usernames in auth-to-local rules

property.name: ad_create_attributes_template
property.description: A Velocity template to use to generate a JSON-formatted document containing the set of attribute names and values needed to create a new Kerberos identity in the relevant Active Directory. Variables include: principal_name, principal_primary, principal_instance, realm, realm_lowercase, normalized_principal, principal digest, password, is_service, container_dn

property.name: create_ambari_principal
property.description: Indicates whether Ambari should create the principal, keytab for itself, used by different views.

property.name: kdc_create_attributes
property.description: The set of attributes to use when creating a new Kerberos identity in the relevant (MIT) KDC.

property.name: ipa_user_group
property.description: The group in IPA user principals should be member of

property.name: preconfigure_services
property.description: Indicates whether to pre-configure services or not. If pre-configuring services, indicates whether to pre-configure all or those explicitly flagged to be pre-configured. Possible values are DEFAULT, NONE, or ALL
